intro: Peucedanum mucronatum, commonly known as the narrow-lobed angelica, is a biennial or perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces small, oval fruits that are typically used in traditional medicine. Its aromatic leaves and roots contain compounds with potential medicinal properties, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its family.
